qas.question: What is the most common reason for software failure?
What do developers commonly do when creating software that can lead to failures?
What is the most common cause for software failure?

answers.text: lack of its compatibility with other application software

qas.question: What often lacks in software developed when its released that can eventually lead to errors?
What does backwards compatibility always seem to be the cause of errors and bugs after a release?

answers.text: test software only on the latest version of the target environment

qas.question: Lack of compatibility with other application software is an uncommon cause of what?
Programmers develop software on the earliest version of what environment?
What is the most uncommon reason for software failure?
Target environments rarely differ greatly from the what?

context: A common cause of <b5_0>software failure<b5_0/> (real or perceived) is a <a2_0>lack of its <a0_0><b7_0>compatibility with other application software<b7_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>, operating systems (or operating system versions, old or new), or target environments that differ greatly from the <b8_0>original<b8_0/> (such as a terminal or GUI application intended to be run on the desktop now being required to become a web application, which must render in a web browser). For example, in the case of <a3_0>a <a1_0>lack of backward compatibility<a3_0/><a1_0/>, this can occur because the programmers develop and <a4_0>test software only on the latest version of <b6_0>the target<b6_0/> environment<a4_0/>, which not all users may be running. This results in the unintended consequence that the latest work may not function on earlier versions of the target environment, or on older hardware that earlier versions of the target environment was capable of using. Sometimes such issues can be fixed by proactively abstracting operating system functionality into a separate program module or library.
